Take-home Exercise 02

Published

March 2, 2024

import pow.kml in data folder

Code 
pacman::p_load(sf, tmap, tidyverse, lubridate, dplyr)
Code 
kml <- "data/pow.kml"

read all the layers in pow.kml file

Code 
layer_info <- st_layers(kml)
Code 
layer_info
Driver: KML 
Available layers:
               layer_name geometry_type features fields crs_name
1                 Mosques      3D Point       54      2   WGS 84
2 Taoist/Buddhist Temples      3D Point      200      2   WGS 84
3                Churches      3D Point      202      2   WGS 84
4           Hindu Temples      3D Point       23      2   WGS 84
5               Gurdwaras      3D Point        6      2   WGS 84
6              Synagogues      3D Point        2      2   WGS 84
7                  Others      3D Point        3      2   WGS 84
8                  Future      3D Point       94      2   WGS 84
Code 
# Define the layer names based on the provided information
layer_names <- c("Mosques", "Taoist/Buddhist Temples", "Churches", "Hindu Temples", "Gurdwaras", "Synagogues", "Others", "Future")

# Loop through each layer name
for (layer_name in layer_names) {
  # Read the layer
  assign(layer_name, st_read(kml, layer = layer_name))
}
